or because the Repeatability-First-Sent value was outside the range of values held by the server.

outputDataAssetId.description: Data asset to which run results output will be written

toolId.description: ID of the tool to execute

projectName.description: Name of the Project to run the tool under. This Project must exist as a child of the Workspace whose endpoint the RunRequest is submitted to.

command.description:
Command to pass to tool container entrypoint.

If the tool has multiple containers defined, this command is executed on all of them.

If omitted, all containers execute their raw entrypoints.

inlineFiles.description: Encoded inline files to be mounted into the container, e.g. for generated code.

storageId.description: The Storage resource to use for this run.

inputDataAssets.description:
Input DataAssets and associated relativeMountPath for each, relative to the working directory.

Any DataAssetIds which point to SharedStorage must point to
the same SharedStorage specified by sharedStorageId, otherwise the
request will be rejected.

outputDataAssets.description:
Output DataAssets and associated relativeMountPath for each, relative to the working directory.

Any DataAssetIds which point to SharedStorage must point to
the same SharedStorage specified by sharedStorageId, otherwise the
request will be rejected.

nodePoolIds.description: IDs of NodePools to use for this run. If not specified, suitable NodePools will be selected based on the infra requirements of the Tool.

items.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

runtimeDetails.description: Human-readable details about the run status.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the resource was created

toolReport.description: Details provided by the tool (rather than the platform).

UiCommand.description: Command for the UI to invoke

conversationId.description: The ID of the associated Conversation.

dataAssetId.description: ID of the related data asset

investigationId.description: The ID of the associated Investigation

relativeMountPath.description: Mount path, relative to the working directory.
